alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Clarke; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 03 at 6:57PM CST until February 04 at 1:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Monroe County in south central Alabama... North Central Baldwin County in southwestern Alabama... Southeastern Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... * Until 100 AM CST Friday. * At 657 PM CST, Emergency Management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain with several roads impassible across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. The additional heavy rain is going to result in further flooding. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monroeville, Frisco City, Peterman, Uriah, Excel, Homewood, Barlow Bend, Manistee, Jeddo, Palmers Crossroads, Eliska, Gainestown, Mineola, Perdue Hill, Mount Pleasant, Megargel, Claiborne, Goodway, Chrysler and Manila. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
